contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|heartbeat}} '''Heartbeat''' and '''heartbeats''' may refer to: * [[Cardiac cycle]] of the heart * [[Heart sounds]] * [[Pulse]] {{TOC right}} ==Computer technology== * [[Heartbeat (computing)]], a periodic signal generated by hardware or software to indicate normal operation or to synchronize other parts of a system * The interval for keeping alive a [[push e-mail]] connection * [[Heartbeat (program)]], clustering software from Linux-HA project * [[Heartbeat network]], a network of cluster nodes which monitors each node and facilitates communication ==Literature== * [[Heartbeat (novel)|''Heartbeat'' (novel)]], a 2004 novel by Sharon Creech * [[Heartbeat (Steel novel)|''Heartbeat'' (Steel novel)]], a novel by [[Danielle Steel]] ==Film and TV== * [[Heartbeat (1946 film)|''Heartbeat'' (1946 film)]], a 1946 US feature film by Sam Wood, with Ginger Rogers * [[La Chamade (film)|''La Chamade'' (film)]] (English title: ''Heartbeat''), a 1968 French feature film by Alain Cavalier * [[Heart Beat (film)|''Heart Beat'' (film)]], a 1980 US feature film about the love triangle between Jack Kerouac, Carolyn Cassady and Neal Cassady * [[Heartbeat (1993 film)|''Heartbeat'' (1993 film)]], a 1993 NBC TV film * [[Heart Beats (film)|''Heart Beats'' (film)]], a 2007 Indian feature film in the Malayalam language * [[Heartbeats (film)|''Heartbeats'' (film)]], a 2010 Canadian French-English feature film by Xavier Dolan * [[Heartbeat (2010 film)|''Heartbeat'' (2010 film)]], a 2010 South Korean feature film about the illegal trade in human organs * [[HeartBeat (U.S. TV series)|''HeartBeat'' (U.S. TV series)]], an American medical drama running on ABC from 1988 to 1989 * [[Heartbeat (UK TV series)|''Heartbeat'' (UK TV series)]], a British police drama, running from 1992 to 2010 ==Music== === Albums === * [[Heartbeat (Don Johnson album)|''Heartbeat'' (Don Johnson album)]], 1986 * [[Heartbeat (Ruby Lin album)|''Heartbeat'' (Ruby Lin album)]], 1999 * [[Heartbeat (The Oak Ridge Boys album)|''Heartbeat'' (The Oak Ridge Boys album)]], 1987 * [[Heartbeat (Sakamoto album)|''Heartbeat'' (Sakamoto album)]], 1991 * [[Heartbeat (Curtis Mayfield album)|''Heartbeat'' (Curtis Mayfield album)]], 1979 * [[Heartbeat (Sarah Engels album)|''Heartbeat'' (Sarah Engels album)]], 2011 * [[Heart Beat (Leehom Wang album)|''Heart Beat'' (Leehom Wang album)]], 2008 * [[Heart Beat (Space Tribe album)|''Heart Beat'' (Space Tribe album)]], 2002 * [[Heart Beats (album)|''Heart Beats'' (album)]], a 2007 album by Danny Saucedo * ''Heartbeat'', an upcoming album by [[Dev (singer)|Dev]] scheduled for release in early 2014 ===Groups=== * [[The Heart Beats]], a 1960s all-female garage rock band * [[The Heartbeats]], a 1950s American doo-wop group === Songs === * [[Heartbeat (Buddy Holly song)|"Heartbeat" (Buddy Holly song)]], 1958 (Covered by Showaddywaddy and Nick Berry) * [[Heartbeat (The Runaways song)|"Heartbeat" (The Runaways song)]], 1977 * [[Heartbeat (Wire song)|"Heartbeat" (Wire song)]], 1978 (also covered by [[Big Black]]) * [[Heartbeat (Taana Gardner song)|"Heartbeat" (Taana Gardner song)]], 1981 * [[Heartbeat (King Crimson song)|"Heartbeat" (King Crimson song)]], 1982 * [[Heartbeat (Don Johnson song)|"Heartbeat" (Don Johnson song)]], 1986 * [[Heartbeat (Jimmy Somerville song)|"Heartbeat" (Jimmy Somerville song)]], 1995 * [[Heartbeat (Steps song)|"Heartbeat" (Steps song)]], 1998 * "Heartbeat", a single from 2000 by French indie pop band [[Tahiti 80]] * [[Heartbeats (song)|"Heartbeats" (The Knife song)]], 2002 * [[Heartbeat (Annie song)|"Heartbeat" (Annie song)]], 2004 * [[Heartbeat (Scouting for Girls song)|"Heartbeat" (Scouting for Girls song)]], 2008 * [[Heartbeat (Late of the Pier song)|"Heartbeat" (Late of the Pier song)]], 2008 * "Heartbeat", a song by Madonna on her 2008 album ''[[Hard Candy (Madonna album)|Hard Candy]]'' * [[Heartbeat (Enrique Iglesias song)|"Heartbeat" (Enrique Iglesias song)]], 2010 * [[Heartbeat (The Fray song)|"Heartbeat" (The Fray song)]], 2011 * "Heartbeat", a song by Childish Gambino on his 2011 album ''[[Camp (album)|Camp]]'' * "Heartbeat", a song by Ross Lynch on his 2012 album" [[Ross Lynch]]" ==Other== * [[Heartbeat (company)]], a video game developer * [[Heartbeat 1521]], formerly "Radio 1521", a defunct radio station in Northern Ireland that was active 1996 â€“ 1999 ==See also== * [[Heartbeat International (disambiguation)]] * [[Beating Heart (disambiguation)]] * [[Hartbeat]], a BBC television children's programme featuring Tony Hart {{disambiguation}}
